Title: Accounting Administrator - Nepean, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Hyatt Place Ottawa is seeking a strong finance professional to join their team. Working closely with the management team, you will conduct day to day financial activities of the hotel, bill and collect all revenue owed to the hotel and verify, obtain approvals and pay all invoices from vendors and associates in a timely, accurate manner in accordance with accounting policies and procedures and Crescent Standards.
At Crescent Hotels & Resorts and Hyatt Place Ottawa we strive to create a great place to work where associates at all levels of our organization are respected for their differences, just like the guests and owners we serve. That’s why we are dedicated to creating an environment that facilitates open and honest conversations about race, equity, diversity, and inclusion. By examining our own beliefs and behaviors, we can create change through training, recruiting, and promoting diverse talent to strengthen our culture.
Here is what you will be doing each day:
Sort and verify accuracy of Night Audit work.
Verify that purchasing procedures are followed, i.e.: purchase order price compared to invoice price, purchase order quantity compared to invoice quantity, ensure that the purchase order number is valid. Maintain an accurate, up to date Purchase Order Log.
Route invoices with purchase order attached to department heads and Executive Committee members for approval. Ensure account coding is accurate and all invoices are being returned on a timely basis.
Process all approved invoices for payment - ensure all appropriate signatures and back-up attached.
Pay all hotel invoices in a timely manner- ensuring accuracy of amount paid, account coding, invoice extension and that all discounts are taken.
Handle all vendor inquiries and reconcile vendor statements.
Maintain open invoices file, paid invoices file and voided check file in an organized and up-to-date manner.
Post city ledger payments in property management system, reconcile and bill all city ledger accounts. Perform follow-up billing and credit collection documentation and inform Controller of any potential uncollectible accounts.
Reconcile credit card back-up to General Cashier Summary and inform Controller of any discrepancies. Bill out credit cards (AMEX, DINERS, etc.). Maintain accurate and legible logs for all credit cards.
Set up new accounts in accordance with established credit policy.
Assist in reconciling open account status items.
Input General Cashier Summary and maintain binder.
File and distribute credit card cancellations, bulletins and credit warnings. Process and follow-up on all returned checks accepted as cash payment.
Ensure the General Ledger, City Ledger and Advance Deposits are reconciled daily.
Work with General Manager and Regional Director, Finance on the month end process to ensure preparation for and month end is completed on schedule.
Required Qualifications & Skills:
Minimum of 1 years' experience working in an Accounting role
Previous experience with payroll required
Experience working with general Accounting principles
Self-starting personality with an even disposition.
Maintain a professional appearance and manner at all times.
Exceptional organizational and time management skills
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral.
* Proof of full vaccination will be required for the successful candidate*
This position is at a location where Hyatt is not the employer. The employer of individuals working at this hotel may be a third-party management company that is responsible for all employment benefits and obligations at this location.

Do you want to be a part of a team that embraces change, and seeks to do things better? Are you a design thinker? Are you a CPA of the future?
At WCB-Alberta, we make a meaningful impact in the lives of working Albertans. We are a not-for-profit organization legislated to administer the workers' compensation system for the province. When any Alberta worker is hurt on the job, we are here to help. We provide compensation and benefits for workplace injuries and occupational diseases to over 1.7 million workers.
The Financial Services team manages the reporting and compliance functions related to financial reporting for the organization. Our reporting is based on IFRS accounting standards, with the soon to be adopted IFRS 17. Our compliance activities encompass process overviews for evaluating risks and assessing the existence and effectiveness of internal controls to manage risks.
We are on a journey to evolve our processes and the ways in which we deliver insight to our customers, using technology as an enabler. We believe in meaningful work, automating the transactional, and focusing our expertise on providing insight to the business. We are shaping the future of reporting and compliance at WCB; if you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference, then we have an opportunity for you.
The Opportunity:
Design, prepare, and present complete and accurate financial records, according to IFRS accounting standards, and soon to be adopted IFRS 17.
Create and maintain working papers and analysis efficiently and effectively, utilizing data tools to automate the transactional aspects, and with thoughtful analysis that provides insight on the status and trends of financial results to various levels of management.
Provide accounting assistance and financial analysis to departments on a monthly and annual basis.
Support financial reporting compliance activities through participation on projects related to internal controls and financial governance.
Evaluate business cases and contracts to provide insight on accounting treatment, budget impacts, and financial risk.
Assist the Finance Management team in projects as assigned, with a specific focus on processes that are in transition and/or undergoing change.
Your experience and skills:
University degree in Business, with a focus on Accounting and Data Analytics.
CPA designation
At least 3-5 years of progressively responsible financial business experience, including working with complex accounting transactions, navigating through change, mapping business processes, and identifying opportunities for improvement
Knowledge of accounting policies and practices (IFRS), internal controls and financial governance practices.
Experience with automated solutions to enhance financial reporting.
Advanced Microsoft 365 (Excel, PowerQuery, PowerPivot, PowerBI) skills are essential.
Proficiency working with Workday Adaptive Planning, and PeopleSoft.
Solid understanding on data management concepts.
Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritize, plan and organize required tasks to meet deadlines.
Well-developed verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical staff, as well as the ability to present analysis in a clear and concise format.
Strong interpersonal, customer service, and consulting skills.
Ability to learn quickly when faced with problems and ambiguity.
Strong conceptual and analytical skills, as well as creativity in identifying options and solutions.
Ability to remain composed when faced with unexpected problems and work effectively through stressful situations.
